headline: ‘We must stand up’: Sen. Portman speaks at prayer vigil, rally for Ukraine held in Parma
author: Jessica Dill
sentences:
“We must stand up, this cannot stand.”
“We can’t acquiesce to a dictator from an authoritarian regime coming into a country that Is independent and simply take over that country” Portman continued.
As seen on the city’s Facebook, many Parma businesses and residents have shown support for Ohio’s Ukrainian community following Russia’s invasion into the country last week.
Mike DeWine was also in Parma Sunday morning, taking in a service at St. Andrew Ukrainian Catholic Church in observance of Ohio’s Day of Prayer for the people of Ukraine.
A rally was also held in downtown Cleveland Saturday in support of Ukraine and Terminal Tower was lit up in Ukrainian flag colors.

Open to all, the event took place at St. Vladimir Ukrainian Orthodox Cathedral, 5913 State Road at 3:30 p.m.
U.S. Sen.
“America and our NATO allies and people all over the world must stand up,” Portman said to a supportive crowd.
PARMA, Ohio (WJW) — A rally and prayer vigil was held in support of Ukraine in Parma Sunday afternoon.
Rob Portman as well as Parma Mayor Tim DeGeeter were in attendance at the free event.

So this is Ukraine’s fight but it’s also our fight.”

If we do, this will happen all around the world.
